alert.note: Alert for Boone; Clay; Kanawha; Logan; McDowell; Mingo; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Raleigh; Roane; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 18 at 12:54AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A line of strong gusty showers will impact portions of north central Buchanan, southeastern Calhoun, northwestern McDowell, eastern Kanawha, southeastern Roane, western Wyoming, northwestern Nicholas, southeastern Mingo, southwestern Braxton, northwestern Raleigh, eastern Logan, Clay, northwestern Fayette and eastern Boone Counties through 115 AM EST... At 1250 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong gusty showers across central and southern West Virginia, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clay, Montgomery, Chesapeake, Marmet, Ansted, Oceana, Belle, Clendenin, Cedar Grove, East Bank, Glasgow, Smithers, Man, Gauley Bridge, Pratt, Van, Gilbert Creek, Birch River, Mallory and Burnwell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 21 and 59. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 58 and 89. Route 19 between mile markers 51 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Clay; Kanawha; Logan; McDowell; Mingo; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Raleigh; Roane; Wyoming
